title: Cheese or Font? Take the Test.
content:
If this has already been posted I apologize but this is hysterical,  
test your knowledge of chees vs. font names here:

[http://cheeseorfont.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730175457/http:/cheeseorfont.com/ "http://cheeseorfont.com/")
author: nancy sharon collins

comments.content: Oh Nancy, that quiz is so [mid-September](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730175457/http:/typophile.com/node/61988)... ;-)

dear eliason,

well, we're a little slow here, but it is funny.
Yup, funny and surprisingly difficult, to me anyway.

They need to do a little better research:

The example was Beaufort. I chose "font":

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730175457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cheese_6518.png)

And yet:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730175457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/beaufort_6596.png)

It's a floor wax _and_ a dessert topping.

Cheers!

hi,

i think dberlow is right, it is a floor wax and dessert topping!

i do think its hysterical that fonts are perceived as names not even categories, however. (i'm pretty sure there were more than one goof-ball one in there but i opted to do the one that didn't keep score, just said right or wrong. so i'm a cheesey weenie.)

Shimmer is a [floor wax, a dessert topping](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730175457/http:/snltranscripts.jt.org/75/75ishimmer.phtml) and a [typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730175457/http:/typophile.com/wiki/hhttp%3A/%252Fwww.bvfonts.com/fonts/details.php%3Fid%3D50).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730175457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/shimmer_3540.jpg)

WOW! Nick, you win (my husband had to explain this to me about a year ago).

Though I have long been a favorite of the Chevy Chase "Shimmer" bit.
